intro: Randia obcordata, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a reddish tint on the underside. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces small, round, orange or red berries. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to coastal or dry environments.
